properties.title: SOD - How to Interpret This Consists Of

section.name: The 'This Consists Of' Section of the Tactics Documentation
section.p: During startup, SOD validates the structure of the strategy file. From the 'sod' element at the root to strings and numbers at the deepest levels of the structure, only certain items are allowed. The 'This Consists Of' section of the Tactic documentation describes the allowed structure for the entirety of the current tactic. If you don't know anything about XML it would be helpful to read our introduction before reading this document. The explanation uses the terminology of XML to explain what the pieces are.

section.name: A Basic Example
section.p: This the 'This consists of' section of the origin point distance tactic.

section.name: The containing originPointDistance tag
section.p: The first line shows the start tag <originPointDistance> . This means that at this point in the strategy file (ie every place in the 'Places containing this' section) the element originPointDistance along with its contents are acceptable. The next three lines along the black line must appear inside the originPointDistance element since they're directly below and indented from it. The black line indicates they're grouped together and must appear in the order they're given going down the page.

section.name: The latitude and longitude elements
section.p: So the latitude element must be the first thing inside of the originPointDistance element. latitude only contains one thing, a 'double'. Text without brackets in bold indicates a single piece of data. Here anything that matches a generic datatype is acceptable. To see what qualifies under the umbrella of this datatype, click on its link. Since this is a double, pretty much any numeric value can be given. After the latitude element and its double contents, the very similar longitude element must be added to originPointDistance. It is also just an element with a double value inside of it.

section.name: Generic range definition
section.p: Finally, there is a link to range. A simple link like range without any brackets indicates that the link should be replaced with the 'This consists of' section in the page it links to. So to see what must go in the place of the range link, click on it to get to its page. It consists of a unit, min and max element. The unit element links to a deeper page which in turn shows that it must be a complete unit element with a unit of distance inside of it. So <unit>KILOMETER</unit> or <unit>MILE</unit> can replace the unit element in range. The min and max elements are very similar to the latitude and longitude elements defined earlier. They're just a simple element with a double inside of them. So the range link in originPointDistance should be replaced with a unit element, a min element, and a max element.

section.name: Putting it all together
section.p: So taking each of those previous sections, this is telling us that originPointDistance consists of an originPointDistance tag with latitude, longitude, unit, min and max tags inside of it as follows:

section.name: Any number of times
section.p: This indicates that whatever item is next to this can appear any number of times, from 0 to infinity. So if a choice has this next to it, you can use as many of the items in the choice as you want, as many times as you want. If it's next to a regular item that item can be left out of the strategy file completely, or you can use 16 of them in a row

section.name: At Least Once
section.p: This indicates the item this is associated with can appear as many times as you want, as long as it appears once.

section.name: choice
section.p: A choice says the you can use one of the items inside of it. The items inside of a choice are the ones closest to the dashed lined coming out of the choice. If the choice is followed by 'optional' that means you can use one of the items inside of it, but you can also leave these out. If choice is followed by 'at least once' you must select one item out of the choice, but you can also select six items out of the choice, or you can select the same item 12 times. Any combination works. If the choice is followed by "any number of times" it works like it has optional and at least once on it. You can ignore the choice entirely, or you can use the items in it over and over again.

section.name: group
section.p: This indicates the items inside the group(the ones next to the black vertical line) must appear together and in the order given. The group can be 'optional' meaning you can take or leave the whole block. It can be 'at least one' meaning you have to have at least one of it, and you can have as many more copies after the first that you like. 'any number of times' following it is like having both 'optional' and 'at least once'. You can leave it out, or you can have it six times, or you can use it once.

section.name: optional
section.p: If an item has 'optional' showing up after it, you can include it in your SOD strategy file or you can leave it out entirely.
